TaxonIdentification.species_name: 圆锥薹草 yuan zhui tai cao

treatment.description: Rhizome shortly creeping, indurate. Culms loosely tufted, 30–45[–90] cm tall, compressed trigonous, scabrous above, clothed with brown or dark brown bladeless sheaths at base. Leaves shorter than culm, blades linear, 2–3 mm wide, flat, margins scabrous, apex acuminate. Involucral bracts setaceous, shorter than inflorescence. Inflorescence spicate-paniculate, 2–3.5 cm; sometimes lowest spike ± branched; spikes androgynous, broadly ovate, 5–7 mm. Female glumes ferruginous-brown, broadly ovate, ca. 3 × 2 mm, 3-veined, margins pale hyaline, apex acuminate. Utricles ferruginous-brown, greenish above, subequaling glume, broadly ovate, plano-convex, ca. 3 × 2 mm, leathery, with 4 or 5 short veins at base abaxially, nerveless adaxially, base broadly subcordate, spongy, shortly stipitate, distal margins denticulate, apex gradually contracted into a serrulate-margined and narrowly winged beak ca. 1 mm. Nutlets tightly enveloped, obovate, plano-convex, ca. 1.4 × 1.2 mm, base broadly cuneate, shortly stipitate; style base slightly thickened; stigmas 2. Fl. and fr. Jul. 2n = 48, 50, 54, 60.
treatment.distribution: Alpine lakes, marshes, boggy meadows. Nei Mongol [Russia (Far East, Siberia); C and SW Asia, C and N Europe, North America, Pacific islands (New Zealand)].
